justification: The article states that “the Austrian report of the international Generations & Gender Survey (GGS; Buber-Ennser et al., 2013) … examined outcomes such as father-child contact after separation,” linking this construct directly to the GGS instrument.

The review notes that “two studies used a combination of an observational assessment (for parent-child attachment) and questionnaires,” indicating that parent-child attachment was specifically measured through an observational assessment method.

It is reported that “one study (Piskernik & Ahnert, 2019) implemented an intensive longitudinal design … using an experience sampling procedure” and that this study “examined fathers’ engagement with their children,” showing that the construct was captured via an experience sampling method.
